simpledb.index.hash.linear
Class LinearHashIndex

java.lang.Object
  simpledb.index.hash.linear.LinearHashIndex
All Implemented Interfaces:
Index
public class LinearHashIndex
extends java.lang.Object
implements Index

Class to manage a linear hash index, which creates new buckets as needed once the ratio of total records to buckets reaches 1.7

Since:
CS4432-Project2
Author:
Andrew Yee

Constructor Detail

LinearHashIndex

public LinearHashIndex(java.lang.String idxname,
                       Schema sch,
                       Transaction tx)
Opens a linear hash index for the specified index

Parameters:
idxname - the name of the index
sch - the schema of the index records
tx - the calling transaction
Method Detail

beforeFirst

public void beforeFirst(Constant searchkey)
Positions the index before the first index record having the specified search key. The method hashes the search key to determine the bucket, and then opens a table scan on the file corresponding to the bucket. The table scan for the previous bucket (if any) is closed. Method functionality same as SimpleDB's HashIndex

Specified by:
beforeFirst in interface Index
Parameters:
searchkey - the key that will determine the bucket
See Also:
Index.beforeFirst(simpledb.query.Constant)

close

public void close()
Closes the index by closing the current table scan.

Specified by:
close in interface Index
See Also:
Index.close()

delete

public void delete(Constant dataval,
                   RID datarid)
Deletes the specified record from the table scan for the bucket. The method starts at the beginning of the scan, and loops through the records until the specified record is found.

Specified by:
delete in interface Index
Parameters:
dataval - the value of the record being deleted
datarid - the RID of the record being deleted
See Also:
Index.delete(simpledb.query.Constant, simpledb.record.RID)

getDataRid

public RID getDataRid()
Retrieves the dataRID from the current record in the table scan for the bucket.

Specified by:
getDataRid in interface Index
Returns:
the RID of the current record
See Also:
Index.getDataRid()

insert

public void insert(Constant dataval,
                   RID datarid)
Inserts a new record into the table scan for the bucket. If the ratio is exceeded, bucket contents will need to be reorganized and the number of buckets will increase.

Specified by:
insert in interface Index
Parameters:
dataval - the value of the record being inserted
datarid - the RID of the record being inserted
See Also:
Index.insert(simpledb.query.Constant, simpledb.record.RID)

reorganize

void reorganize()
Reorganizes current index for the increase in buckets.

checkRatioPlusOne

boolean checkRatioPlusOne()
Checks the ratio of records to buckets, accounting for an extra record

Returns:
true if the ratio is >= 1.7 false if the ratio is < 1.7

next

public boolean next()
Moves to the next record having the search key. The method loops through the table scan for the bucket, looking for a matching record, and returning false if there are no more such records.

Specified by:
next in interface Index
Returns:
true if the next matching record is found false if there is no next matching record
See Also:
Index.next()

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Outputs the contents of the index in String form

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
String representation of index contents
